name: compadre
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a friend or someone you trust, for example because they work with you or come from the same place as you; used especially by or of a Spanish-speaking person: He referred to the Mexican president as a compadre.
More examplesFewer examplesAmong Stuart's most important compadres were his fellow Mississippians B. B. King and the Staple Singers."Culturally, we have a trust that 'this guy's not going to do me wrong, he's my compadre,'" she said. He and three compadres are now planning to ride off into the sunset for a well-earned early retirement.
